FuncDef: The upgrade download-package command downloads a specified file to an AP.
CLIs: upgrade download-package <packagename> [ server-ip <ip-address> server-port <port-number> ] { { ap-id { <startapid> [ to <endapid> ] } &<1-10> } | all-ap }

ParaDef.Info:
Specifies the name of a file to be downloaded.
The value is a string of 5 to 127 case-sensitive characters, spaces not supported.

Specifies the IP address of a server.
The value is in dotted decimal notation.

Specifies the port number of a server.
The value is an integer ranging from 1 to 65535.

Specifies a start AP ID.
The value is an integer ranging from 1024 to 8191.

Specifies an end AP ID. An end AP ID cannot be less than a start AP ID.
The value is an integer ranging from 1024 to 8191.

Downloads a file to all APs.
-

ExtraInfo:
Usage Scenario
To switch a software version for an AP, run the upgrade download-package command to download a system file to the AP. To run a patch file for an AP, run the upgrade download-package command to download the patch file to the AP.
To download a file from a master to a specified AP, run the upgrade download-package ap-id command.
To download a file from a master to all APs, run the upgrade download-package all-ap command.
To download a file from a specified server to a specified AP, run the upgrade download-package server-ip server-port  ap-id command.
To download a file from a specified server to all APs, run the upgrade download-package server-ip server-port all-ap command.
Precautions
After this command is run, a user must enter an SFTP user name and password as prompted.
This command is supported only on the admin VS.
